content.section_header: Select the SYNONYM for each bold word.

content.question: Her complicated teaching method makes simple subjects abstruse.
If the club doubted Toby’s penitence after he misused the funds, his hard work at every subsequent event convinced them.
The squad knew that practice was the key to winning, so their acquiescence to the intense rehearsal schedule came without a murmur of objection.
The car salesperson’s customers appreciated his probity.
After a heated debate, the manager acquiesced to Yvonne’s demand for a raise.

content.section_header: Select the ANTONYM for each bold word.

content.question: The surfeit of ice cream varieties at the Dream Cream Ice Cream Parlor made it hard for Luz to decide which one she wanted in her sundae.
Judging from that gory movie he took me to, Brian has unsavory tastes in film.
The bank would stand for no improprieties from the tellers when it came to the way they handled their cash.
Mark was penitent about forgetting to pick up his grandparents at the airport.
The intellectual edifice of art history has accrued over many years through the work of artists and scholars.

content.section_header: Choose the best way to complete each sentence or answer each question

content.question: Something with an unsavory aroma smells
Which of the following is most likely to accrue?
Nathan inveigled concert money from his mother by
A revelation makes what was unknown
Purporting to be related to someone means to

content.section_header: Read the passage and answer the questions

passage: Parents of toddlers often have a difficult time doing basic tasks such as grocery shopping because their children are still learning how to behave in public. Toddlers are known for their histrionic temper tantrums and other improprieties that cause people around them to cringe or complain—particularly people who don’t have children of their own and don’t remember what it was like to be a child. That is why you see many parents inveigling their toddlers into being quiet with the promise of a treat or giving them a toy to play with as they shop.

It may help for parents to be as explicit as possible about the rules for their child. For example, just before going to a grocery store, a parent might explain: “We use only quiet voices in this store.” However, toddlers are not old enough to fully understand the repercussions of their actions. Their sense of right and wrong is still very limited, and when they are tired and cranky, after being told “no” a lot, they tend to ignore rules.

content.question: In line 4, histrionic means
The word improprieties (line 4) most nearly means
In line 8, inveigling most nearly means
The meaning of explicit (line 11) is
In line 15, repercussions most nearly means
